div.p: Welcome to our ACCESS online program.
My name is Father Tom Dailey and I direct the Salesian Center for Faith
and Culture here at DeSales University.
Salesian is one of those words that we use that refers to Saint Francis DeSales
who is the patron of the university.
I've been asked to chat with you briefly about the mission of the university and some
of the common core courses that everyone here at DeSales takes even in the online program.
In thinking about this, I was laughing to myself that we are doing here
in the 21st century a new version
of what Francis DeSales did some 400 years ago in France.
At the time the new technology in those days was the printing press,
and Saint Francis De Sales is known for having made use of the printing press
to spread the message about Catholicism to people all around Switzerland.
It was precisely that new technology that helped him to get people's attention and to get them
to talk about some of the more important things they were considering in life.
In essence that's what we're doing here.
As a university as a whole, we seek in all that we teach to talk
about the important things, to talk about truth.
And as you know, truth comes in many forms.
In the sense that we're going to teach you courses that will give you the truth
in whatever subject matter you're studying, whatever it is that you're majoring in--
the skills in business, the techniques in science--
or whatever it is that you're studying.
But there are also truths of a different nature that go beyond that sort
of scientific and technical skill level.
So for instance, the truth about beauty in life--
we have a stellar performing and fine arts here on campus and we celebrate that truth
that is beauty a truth that every human being knows
when you see a really good show or dance performance.
We talk about truth in terms of philosophy or theology.
These all the kinds of courses that everyone at the university is going to have to take as part
of our general education core curriculum because we believe there is a core of knowledge
that affects every human being, no matter what it is you're studying,
because it goes to the heart of what it means to be a human being.
So even online, you'll be asked to think about deep questions to ponder the mysteries of life
to come up with some answers for yourselves because whatever knowledge it is
that you're going to take form these online courses it's really that knowledge not simply
about the content but knowledge about yourself that's important.
So even as you learn to master this new technology of online courses,
remember that learning isn't just about learning stuff,
or learning new technologies or new gadgets.
It's really untimely learning about ourselves.
This is primarily the mission of the university it is a profound teaching of Francis DeSales
from 400 years ago who taught that, among other things his, one of his more famous sayings is
that we should be who we are and be that perfectly well.
What he meant by that is that we kind of waste our time and energy if we're trying
to be someone else if we're trying to be something that we're not.
Because every single one of us, every single one
of you taking these courses, is gifted in a unique way.
So be that, and become that, and learn more about that
and be who you are, and be that perfectly well.
That's our mission.
That's what grounds out educational philosophy.
That's why you'll be taking a lot of courses that may be outside you're area of interest
or outside of your area of expertise.
But they're courses that hopefully will make you expert in being human.
So again, welcome to DeSales University and the online program-doing
in the 21st century the very same things that Francis DeSales did 400 years ago.
Hopefully you will join with us in continuing that tradition of learning to be
who we are and to be that perfectly well.
